title: The Yang-Mills Mass Gap: A Constructive Proof via Banach Contraction (UIDT v3.7.2)
description: This submission presents a constructive proof of the Yang-Mills mass gap problem for SU(3) gauge theory in four-dimensional Euclidean spacetime. The proof establishes the existence and uniqueness of a spectral gap Δ* = 1.710 ± 0.015 GeV through application of the Banach fixed-point theorem to a self-consistent gap equation derived from the Functional Renormalization Group. The Lipschitz constant L = 3.749 × 10⁻⁵ < 1 guarantees contraction, with numerical verification to 250 decimal digits. BRST gauge consistency is demonstrated via explicit verification of Q² = 0 nilpotency and Slavnov-Taylor identities. The result agrees with quenched (pure gauge) lattice QCD determinations of the pure Yang-Mills spectrum (z-score: 0.37σ). ERRATUM (v3.7.1): Following Lattice 2024 findings (Morningstar 2025, arXiv:2502.02547), the spectral gap Δ* is explicitly identified as a mathematical property of the pure Yang-Mills Hamiltonian spectrum—not an observable particle mass. In full QCD with dynamical quarks, glueball-meson mixing prevents isolation of a predominantly gluonic state below ~2 GeV. All mathematical proofs remain valid and unchanged.

method: Banach Fixed-Point Theorem applied to FRG-derived gap equation with BRST gauge consistency verification, Osterwalder-Schrader axiom verification, and 250-digit numerical precision. Spectral gap represents pure Yang-Mills Hamiltonian spectrum.
